definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: They climb walls, leap off buildings and spy on enemies.
sentences.chinese: 它们会爬墙，能跳下大楼，还能暗中监视敌人。

sentences.english: In those days we did not need spies to watch the enemy's movement .
sentences.chinese: 在那些日子里，我们不需要情报员注意敌人动向。

sentences.english: The navy tied the enemy down with gunfire.
They  fired at a fleeting enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他们向正在逃跑的敌人开火。

sentences.english: We have our enemy almost surrounded.
sentences.chinese: 我们差不多把敌人包围起来了。

sentences.english: The Bible tells us to forgive our enemies; not our friends. – Margot Asquith.
sentences.chinese: 圣经告诉我原谅我们的敌人，但没说要原谅朋友。

sentences.english: The enemy was advancing. The snow was stained with blood.
sentences.chinese: 首都被迫弃守，敌人步步进逼，鲜血将白雪浸染。

sentences.english: The possibility of a last-ditch resistance by the enemy should not be dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 敌人负隅顽抗的可能性是不可不加考虑的。

sentences.english: I stand on my front feet and do a handstand to warn my enemies.
sentences.chinese: 当我警告敌人时，会立起前足倒立。

sentences.english: Wow he send weapons to the enemy who beheads Christians.
sentences.chinese: 哇他竟然给斩杀基督徒的敌人运送武器。

sentences.english: Enemies hit by meteors are knocked down, 25 second recharge.
sentences.chinese: 被陨石雨击中的敌人将倒地，25秒回复。

sentences.english: But the enemy surrendered before Luigi could find Alberto.
sentences.chinese: 但是在路易基能找到阿尔贝托之前，敌人投降了。

sentences.english: The enemy are in the forest and must be dislodged .
sentences.chinese: 敌人在丛林里，必须将他们赶出来。

sentences.english: As the enemy retreated, we were ordered to disengage.
sentences.chinese: 当敌人退却时我们受命撤出战斗。

sentences.english: The enemy must've been using it to dig their tu els.
sentences.chinese: 敌人一定是用生化战场激活码他来挖地洞。

definition: to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
